alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 4:48PM EDT until June 02 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 448 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Holly, or 16 miles south of Trenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Toms River, Medford, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Mount Holly, Presidential Lakes Estates, Lakehurst, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Warren Grove, Leisuretowne, Chatsworth, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Presidential Lakes, Holiday City-Berkeley, Bamber Lake, Cedar Glen Lakes and Whiting. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 6A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
